body.p:
To His Excellency
B Magoffin Governor of Kentucky.

The undersigned represents to yr. Excellency, that at the late September Term of the Edmonson Equity & Criminal Court, he was fined fifity Dollars, under an Indictment for an assault upon one Joseph Lewis. He represents that the verdict was founded alone upon the evidence of the family of said Lewis. He says he is poor, that the fine is unjust and should not be collected -- He prays that said fine be remitted.
Sept 1860
The undersigned unite with the petitioner James Bryant and ask that the fine referred to be remitted, the reasons therefore in our judgment being sufficient
